resources.string: Intra protects you from DNS manipulation, a cyber attack used to block access to news sites, social media platforms and messaging apps.\n\nWhile Intra protects you against DNS manipulation, there are other more complicated blocking techniques and attacks that Intra doesn\'t protect against.

Intra protects your connection to the Domain Name System (DNS), which provides the exact addresses that you need to visit a website or open an app.\n\nIntra uses encryption to ensure that results can\’t be manipulated, helping you safely access the Internet.
Tap OK to allow Intra to protect your DNS requests. By default, they will be routed to Google Public DNS (Privacy Policy). You can choose another service in the app settings.
Intra was made by Jigsaw. IP locations are based on data from DB-IP.com.
Your connection is exposed to DNS attacks.
Your connection is protected from DNS attacks.
Your connection is currently protected by Android Private DNS, but an attacker could disable or undermine this protection.
Intra has detected that the Android Private DNS setting is enabled. This means that your DNS queries are already protected, so there\'s no need to enable Intra.
Just a moment. Intra is establishing a server connection.
Your device is offline. Intra is waiting for a network connection.
Intra has detected another VPN on your device. If you enable Intra, that VPN will be disabled. Intra is not as secure as a trusted VPN.
Warning: Queries are failing. You may want to choose a different server and restart Intra.
DNS queries happen when your device looks up the IP address for a domain name

This value shows the total number of DNS queries that your device has performed while Intra was active. Intra encrypts these queries and sends them to a trusted server to make sure that you\'re receiving authentic results.
DNS queries happen at the beginning of each connection
This value shows the number of DNS queries that your device has performed in the last minute. Loading a complex web page can require over a hundred DNS queries.
Encryption protects your queries from prying eyes
When you use Intra, your DNS queries are encrypted, so that only you and your DNS server can see what DNS queries you are making. Intra implements the DNS over HTTPS protocol for encryption.

Most devices and networks use basic DNS, which is unencrypted, so your DNS queries could be observed or modified by anyone on the network. Some new devices support DNS over TLS, which encrypts your queries but can\'t protect you if the server is malicious.
You deserve to use a trustworthy DNS server
This field shows the name of the secure DNS server that you\'re using. You can also change to a different server in the Settings menu.
You can choose your own DNS server

When Intra is disabled, most devices are pre-configured to use the DNS server that your network operator picks. This field shows the IP address of the DNS server that your device is currently using. With Intra or Android P, you can easily select a server of your choice.
This field shows the name of the DNS server that you configured in Android\'s Private DNS setting. When Intra is disabled, your apps should send DNS queries to this server.
Please visit their website to review their privacy policy and any applicable terms of service.
Custom server must be a valid https:// URL
DNS queries from any selected apps will not go through Intra. If an app appears to be incompatible with Intra, you can add it here.
Mark apps to exclude from Intra
This functionality is not available on your version of Android.
Tap to change DNS protection setting
This notification appears while DNS protection is active.
Shown when Intra has encountered a problem.
